description: syscall: add some new syscall numbers from NetBSD-current

messages.text:
On 7 August 2012 22:48, Benny Siegert <bsiegert@gmail.com> wrote:
> Thanks.
>
> FYI, mkerrors.sh errors out on NetBSD due to a syntax error in
> <net/if_types.h> which has been in there since 2002. See
> http://gnats.netbsd.org/46771 .

Heh, I forgot that I ended up hacking around that - thanks for reporting it :)

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=98c1ecd82cb5 ***

syscall: add some new syscall numbers from NetBSD-current

R=golang-dev
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6454100

Committer: Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org>

Thanks.

FYI, mkerrors.sh errors out on NetBSD due to a syntax error in
<net/if_types.h> which has been in there since 2002. See
http://gnats.netbsd.org/46771 .

--Benny.

subject: code review 6454100: syscall: add some new syscall numbers from NetBSD-current
